slide.text: "Great job! You made a real app with a trivia question. But it\\u0027s not fun when there\\u0027s only one question, right?"
"To add more trivia questions, you can return on the entire process you went through. In this lesson we\\u0027ll remember what we did exactly and notice some important things."

"In the Design screen we\\u0027ll add a Text element for every question and a Button for every answer. Every element\\u0027s ID should be unique, but if many elements have a similar role, we can give the the same name and a number."

"In the Code screen we\\u0027ll create a function for every question, in which we\\u0027ll write the code that gives the button a name in code, and changes it text to the answer. The name of the function should also be unique."
"Back in the Design screen, we\\u0027ll define each button\\u0027s OnClick property to be it\\u0027s acquivalent function."
"In order to keep things in order, we should pick a number for every question and name the functions and IDs accordingly."

exercise.question: "It\\u0027s best to give every button in the app the same ID."
"How many function would we need if we have 6 trivia questions?"
"It\\u0027s best to name functions after friends and food."
"A button\\u0027s ID is answerButton2, what names could we give the function that goes with that button so it would make most sense?"

task.text: "Add more trivia questions to your app."
